text: Campagne-lès-Guines is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in the Nord- Pas de Calais region of France. ==Geography== A farming village located 10 miles (16 km) south of Calais, on the D248 and D215 road junction. ==History== The meeting between Francis I and Henry VIII took place here at Campagne-lès- Guînes in 1546 to conclude the peace treaty of Ardres, which saw Boulogne returned to the French crown, for a sizeable sum of money. ==Population== ==Places of interest== * The church of St.Martin, dating from the nineteenth century. * The nineteenth-century château.. ==See also== *Communes of the Pas- de-Calais department ==References== * INSEE commune file Campagnelesguines Category:Pale of Calais
title: Campagne-lès-Guines
